title: Why is Coronation Street cancelled for one whole week?
text:
Our faces when we realise there’s no Corrie for a week (Picture: ITV)

That’s right soap fans – we’re going to have to be away from The Cobbles for an entire week.

After today, Wednesday 9 October, until Wednesday 16 October, Corrie will not be airing.

Before you go starting any riots, here’s what you need to know about why…

Why is Coronation Street cancelled for a whole week?

Corrie will be off our screens to make way for the UEFA Championship qualifiers.

On Friday 11 October, England will be playing against Czech Republic, and on Monday 14 October, England will be playing Bulgaria.

When Corrie returns, poor Sinead Tinker’s (Katie McGlynn) death will continue to draw nearer, as the beloved character finds herself too sick to carry out everyday tasks.

Elsewhere in Weatherfield, pregnant Gemma (Dolly-Rose Campbell) will get herself stuck in the turnstile trying to get into a football match, and David (Jack P Shepherd) will come face to face with his vile rapist Josh (Ryan Clayton) while in prison.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Coronation Street is next on tonight, 9 October, at 7:30pm on ITV.

description: That's right soap fans - we're going to have to be away from Corrie for an entire week. Here's why...
